intro: Colchicum bivonae, commonly known as the Alpine meadow colchicum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Colchicaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and has a short, erect flowering stem. Its flowers are typically purple or pink, with six petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Colchicum bivonae is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils.
